poem:
**Oscar and Boise**

Ballet whispers,
shadows reel under
archways of longing,
pirouettes of hidden
passions—an illicit touch
waltzes past the edge
of propriety.
In the footfalls
of forbidden love,
they carve delicate
eternities—silent,
yet so loud
in the symphony of night.
